data.title: Institute for Intellectual Property and Social Justice
data.meta_description: Institute for Intellectual Property and Social Justice  | 713 followers on LinkedIn. Advancing Ideas, Encouraging Enterprise, Protecting People | IIPSJ was established to address the social justice implications of intellectual property law and policy both domestically and globally. IIPSJ’s broad work includes the scholarly examination of intellectual property law from the social justice perspective; advocacy for social justice-cognizant interpretation, application, and revision of the intellectual property law; efforts to increase the diversity of the intellectual property legal bar; and programs to empower historically and currently disadvantaged and marginalized communities through the development, protection, use, and exploitation of intellectual property.
data.text:
All IP for the People webinar videos are now available on our YouTube page! In the past year, we had speakers cover topics on protecting your brand, how to go from inventor to entrepreneur, practical details on starting up your business, and more. Check them out and stay tuned for a new webinar coming in September. In the meantime, if you have topics you'd like to hear more about or specific questions you'd like answered, please email us at info@iipsj.org. View the IP for the People YouTube playlist here: https://lnkd.in/ew9KPXtX Full webinar details are provided here: https://lnkd.in/gwSiGqTV To be notified of new webinars and other events, sign up for our newsletter here: https://iipsj.org/ #intellectualproperty #socialjustice #intellectualpropertylaw #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyeducation #intellectualpropertyprotection

Time is running out! The final deadline for submissions of paper and project abstracts (300 words) for presentation at the 10th Annual IP Mosaic Conference is AUGUST 1, 2024. The theme of this year's conference is Looking Forward, Looking Back: IP Social Justice & Promoting Human Ingenuity. Submit to ipmosaic@iipsj.org with subject line “IP Mosaic Submission 2024 — [Last Name]." Please include a statement identifying if you’ve presented at the conference in the past two years. Visit our website for more details: https://lnkd.in/eeJFWnY4 #intellectualproperty #socialjustice #intellectualpropertyeducation

Institute for Intellectual Property and Social Justice is attending the 65th Series of General Assembly Meetings of the World Intellectual Property Organization – WIPO in Geneva, between 9-17 July 2024. In addition to our written statement, we delivered the one minute oral statement today (Wednesday, 10 July 2024), stressing the importance of abolishing intersectional discrimination, in all our creative and innovative ecosystems. Intersectionality has to be at the core of all gender work, and has to be considered in data collection projects as well. The (oral) statement is available online (WIPO webcast, at 02:31:12): https://lnkd.in/e82KxE3z All information and documents of the 65th GA, are available online: https://lnkd.in/eVpKsz4J

PODCAST ALERT! IIPSJ Founder and Director Lateef Mtima recently sat down with The Vanguard Network for "It's Not Woke–It's Constitutional," where he discussed the social justice implications of intellectual property for both businesses and individual creatives, and how intellectual property can aid the collective good. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/edfVPMRF #intellectualproperty #socialjustice #intellectualpropertylaw #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyeducation #intellectualpropertyprotection

BLOG POST: USPTO Announces National Strategy for Inclusive Innovation At an event on Capitol Hill on May 1, the USPTO, in conjunction with the agency’s work with the Council for Inclusive Innovation (CI2), a new National Strategy for Inclusive Innovation. The Strategy aims to grow the economy, create quality jobs, and address global challenges by increasing participation in STEM, inventorship, and innovation among youth and those from historically underrepresented and underresourced communities. IIPSJ is encouraged that, through the National Strategy for Inclusive Innovation, the USPTO takes a leadership role in meeting the great challenge of confronting the demographic, economic, and geographic under-representation of citizens in the innovation economy, and commends the National Strategy for Inclusive Innovation and its social justice-oriented perspective towards the American innovation ecosystem. Read the full comment from IIPSJ here: https://lnkd.in/eKg-kmFi Read the full announcement from the USPTO here: https://lnkd.in/ezbERdii #intellectualproperty #socialjustice #intellectualpropertylaw #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyprotection

CALL FOR PAPERS! The IP Mosaic Conference Planning Board invites IP scholars, policy makers, and social activists to submit paper and project proposals for presentation at the 10th Annual IP Mosaic Conference, which will be hosted at the Marquette University Law School on November 1-2, 2024. The theme of this year's conference is Looking Forward, Looking Back: IP Social Justice & Promoting Human Ingenuity. Paper and project abstracts (300 words) will be considered on a rolling basis with an initial submission deadline of June 30, 2024; the final deadline for consideration of submissions is August 1, 2024. Submit to ipmosaic@iipsj.org with subject line “IP Mosaic Submission 2024 — [Last Name]." Please include a statement identifying if you’ve presented at the conference in the past two years. Visit our website for more details on the conference and paper/project submissions: https://lnkd.in/eeJFWnY4 #intellectualproperty #socialjustice #intellectualpropertyeducation

The USPTO Invention-Con on the Road on May 1 is your chance to connect with inventors and experts at the epicenter of innovation. Hosted virtually and in person at the USPTO's Silicon Valley Regional Office in San Jose, CA, this free event is tailored for the independent inventor community to get intellectual property essentials, gain insight from the pros and access free resources. Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/e7JSY4Ny Register here: https://lnkd.in/eeVkMrqP #IntellectualPropertyLaw #intellectualproperty #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyprotection #patents #trademarks #inventors #inventions

Join us! IIPSJ Board Member Lita Rosario-Richardson will be providing the opening remarks at the United States Intellectual Property Alliance - USIPA Entertainment, Arts & Sports Virtual IP Roundtable Discussion: “With the Advancements of Technology and AI, Do We Really Have Control of our NIL and IP?” on May 1 at 4pm ET. Register here: https://lnkd.in/ggCp3Zsr #IntellectualPropertyLaw #intellectualproperty #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyprotection #NIL

In celebration of World IP Day tomorrow, please join IIPSJ partner Professor Yolanda K., Director of the UIC Center for Intellectual Property, Information, & Privacy Law and Professor of Copyright Law and Property, at the World Intellectual Property Day Women in IP Panel: Opportunities & Challenges. This free, virtual panel is scheduled from 11:30am - 1pm CT, and will be moderated by IIPSJ Board Member Esther Lim. What better time to recognize the achievements of women in IP than on World IP Day! Register here: https://lnkd.in/dr5peuKA. #IntellectualPropertyLaw #intellectualproperty #intellectualpropertyrights #intellectualpropertyprotection
